description: We were in the area and thought it might be fun.  Wait staff was terrific and the food even better! We only had dumplings and wish we had ordered more things too. Easily the best dumplings I have ever had, I compared it to home made pasta, they were so fresh and tender.
author: Margie R.

description: Dumplings are nice and fresh. Staff is friendly and attentive. My favorite was the seafood gyoza. Sui mai was nothing special. Like any regular dim sum spots. Tom yum xlb was unique and delicious. Shrimp toast was a nice start for appetizer. Pricing is fair. Worth it to check it out if you're in the area but not to go out of your way for
author: Thomas T.

description: Dumpling time has become a quick favorite! The food is always great & so is the service. Tonight Cheewin was our server & he was amazing. He was so nice & accommodating! Would come back just for him (and the shrimp toast)
author: Julienne P.

description: Another failed attempt at finding good xlb in the bay area - pricey for the portion too
author: Trish M.

description: The food tasted good but it's not really worth the long wait outside in the cold nor the price. The dumplings don't taste authentic, portions are small, and they play music (Korean pop music??) way too loudly that makes it feel more like a club than a restaurant.
author: John E.

description: Best dumplings I've ever had however I'm only giving them four stars because they were out of the delicious noodles that I had the first time I went out there. They also play loud music in the restaurant while projecting music videos against the wall so it's not a place you want to go for a serene dinner.
author: Betty F.

description:
just what SF needs...yet another entirely mediocre gentrified version of a food that exists in top authentic form in plenty of places scattered around the city. anybody who loves or recommends this place is part of the problem. this isn't the midwest, we have the real thing here, we don't need a bullshit wannabe self impressed copy. dim sum does not need to be peppered with edible flower petals to compensate for mediocre flavor and double the price of what it should be. 

the only thing worthwhile on the menu was the string beans which cost twice what they should have ($8 for the equivalent of a half order). F this place. Oh...and the hostess can shove her attitude.
author: jonathan c.

description: If you are looking for authentic and delicious dumpling, then this isn't the place to go. I'd see why my American friends would love it, but as an Asian Chinese, I wouldn't recommended it. Service was friendly, and it's worth the hype
author: Kandice Z.

description: Surprisingly good across the board. We particularly liked the seafood gyoza, the soup dumplings, and the seared buns. Not everything is awesome, but pretty solid across the board. Obviously will be a big improvement when they get a liquor license. Oh, and the egg dessert bun is outstanding.
author: Amjad S.

description: I recommend that some one who has been interesting in Chinese food should go there to try. This restaurant could provide a traditional South of Chinese food.
author: Wei L.

description: Does not live up to its name. We ordered the pork xi'an dumplings, chicken gyoza, and Beijing noodles. Both dumplings had horrible disintegrating/crumbling skin once put into your mouth. It seems the dough has been overworked and no gluten could form. Same for the noodles - no chewy (qq) goodness. Then the filling was underwhelming - no flavoring and relied solely on the dipping sauce for flavor. Same for the pork topping for the noodles - we had to pour the remainder of the gyoza dipping sauce onto the noodles for flavor. Glad we didn't order xlb's or steamed baos. By the looks of them on the neighboring tables, they looked the wrong color and stuck together. Now, I'm going across town to get a proper lunch and dumpling experience.
author: Christina Y.

description: I had pork dumpling, shrimp dumpling and shanghai dumpling.  I think the dumpling just average.
author: K H.

description: Really good!  Seriously, stop at this place and try their grub.   Green beans, dim sum, beers.  All great!
author: George G.

description: It's good. Not the best but reasonable price considering the location and vibe. The service was ok and almost makes it 3 stars but gave them 4 because food warrants it.
author: Ben L.

description: Delicious. And Robert is the best waiter in San Francisco. Ask for Robert.
author: Rachel C.

description: Overrated, overhyped and overpriced. Ordered the green beans, pork xian dumplings and pork xlb - all very disappointing.  Greens beans were dry and not the freshest, lacked the crunch of fresh green beans. Pork xian dumplings met my expectations but there wasn't anything particularly memorable. Xlb came in the metal foil which was a bit hard to remove without breaking the dumpling skin. Really soupy but the dumpling skin was a bit thick and tough. Overall, I came for the novelty of this place but will likely not return.
author: Leeni L.

description: this is the least vegan friendly friendly place.  Every dish has either fish sauce or eggs.  My friend ordered a super sized dumpling and it was still raw in the middle.
author: Yf W.

description: TERRIBLE SERVICES ! Waitress will forget you and your food after waiting for more than 40 minutes while the next table received foods within seconds.  Unbelievable !!! They never check back nor check our food.  So disappointed after reading SF Gate for freshest food.  Just know this - the place is not organize very well at all.  Staff will tell you bullshit things.
author: Doris S.

description: This place is worth the wait and the hassle of getting there from the other side of town. Food is absolutely amazing and very fresh and creative. Service is excellent, but they are really busy (for a reason obviously). DO THIS FOR SURE. Don't miss the noodles or the soup dumplings.
author: Steve B.

description: Don't even think about going here if you're vegan. Nothing's vegan and they won't accommodate you at all (everything is pre-made). Had to run to a Thai restaurant down the block.
author: Robert H.

description: Tasty. Noisy!!! Great service. Don't expect Chinatown prices. Good for a quick bite. Menu is shorter than might be expected. Loved the cilantro sauce that came with the shrimp Har Gow.
author: Annette C.

description: overall great food - the way gyoza is made seems unique. veggies are tasty. and happy endings are yummy. king-dum was fun to eat but tasted ok... but was nice to try! sadly my friend's king-dum soup already leaked out. glad i can do take out here.
author: Julie R.

description: great new dumpling spot in Soma .. its a little busy all the time (first go was a no go because it was so packed) I tried the XLBs (both kinds) and loved them .. cant wait to go back and try everything else
author: Micah W.

description: I'm not a huge dim sum fan but my husband is. Let me tell you, I loved every single thing we ordered!! We got the Beijing noodles- fantastic, shrimp har gao which I normally hate- these had so much flavor one of my favorites! We also ordered the pork gyoza which was amazing as well. The grand finale was the giant soup dumpling- so so good. We will for sure be back when we are in town next!
author: Jessica J.

description: On a week day during lunch, and after the waiter seated us, we were asked "who sat you there"?  We were sent back outside, and after a 15-minute wait wait we were seated and the 2 of us ordered the seafood gyoza, tom yum goong (beet skin wrapping), har gow, crispy bao, and beer.  The gyoza was tepid, the xiao long bao and crispy bao were not as good as dumplings served at other Chinese restaurants, and a bit over-priced for what we got.  The best thing was the beer!
author: JB R.

description: I'm always wary of trying new places, but this one was a winner for me. The Shrimp Toast was amazing. This place is definitely going into my lunch rotation. Don't pass this up!
author: Cassidy S.

description: I couldn't love Dumpling Time more. Although they don't take reservations and there is always a line, the wait (never too long) is definitely worth it! They serve sake in boxes and there's K-Pop videos projected on the wall - so cool. We ordered the Pork Gyoza, Chicken Gyoza, Pork Bao steam buns, and the King-dum soup dumplings. All of them were quite tasty, but I would never order the King-dum again - more for the experience of drinking it through a straw, something you have to try once, but not the best flavor. The gyozas were amazing, and I would suggest getting the bao buns pan-seared - it seems to be their speciality. Green tea and milk buns were the perfect way to end a delcious meal. The one thing I will say that it is a little pricey - I went with my boyfriend and it was around $75 - that's alcohol, 4 types of dumplings, and dessert. However, that is a reality of SF and it provided a great experience. Will definitely be back soon!
author: LoMo P.

description: ummmmmm this is 5 stars.   i think you should go.  like maybe now would be a good time.  you should definitely order the king dum soup dumpling.  The broth inside is beyond good.  The Bejing noodles are also a must order,  along with just about everything else.   Damn it,  just writing the review makes me mad that I don't have any to eat.   The seafood Gyoza is also a must.  Crab, Scallop and shrimp,  yup I want like 38 of these please.   It is recommend that you order all your food at once, they are busy so re ordering anything is a hassle for them.   I would recommend you order way more than you plan on eating.  You most likely will end up eating more than you think and you will also be very thankful that you have left overs to munch on.   This place is absolutely fantastic.  I can't wait to go again.   If you have an ancient person in your house who makes dumplings from the Ming Dynasty recipe book then OK give this place less than 5 stars.  Otherwise sit down order too much and start putting all these tasty treats in your pie hole.   Enjoy!!!!
author: J B.

description: As far as the venue goes it's a very cute little establishment. The real problem with this place is the quality of service. We arrived at 5:55 and were immediately seated which was extremely exciting after all of the reviews I had been reading. We ordered our food and received our packager receipt at 6:06 for four items and we did not see the first item until 6:36. I didn't really pay any mind to it as the ambience was very nice but I expected the food to come out in a steady flow as I had noticed for other tables. We finished our first course and didn't receive the second until 7 pm. At this point I was becoming extremely wary as people who had arrived after us were receiving wave after wave of food. At 7:15 I asked the waiter about that status of our food because we were still starving and he said that the King-Dum takes 15 minutes, while I was trying to explain we had ordered over an hour ago he quickly brushed me off and walked away. At the point I flagged him down and pressed the issue further. When I received my chicken bao I received one less dumpling than advertised and the king-dum was extremely underwhelming and barely had any soup. Overall the food was extremely mediocre for the time waited. I will not be returning.
author: Weston T.
